thread.title: Steve Irwin’s son Robert looks all grown up as he appears on Jimmy Fallon to talk about animals like his famous dad
thread.title_full: Steve Irwin’s son Robert looks all grown up as he appears on Jimmy Fallon to talk about animals like his famous dad

author: amatheson
title: Steve Irwin’s son Robert looks all grown up as he appears on Jimmy Fallon to talk about animals like his famous dad
text:
Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments IT’S been over ten years since animal enthusiast and presenter Steve Irwin passed away and as yet no one has been able to match the Australian presenter’s infectious enthusiasm for the animal world. 
But now, Steve’s 13-year-old son Robert might just be the one to take the torch from his late father after an adorable appearance on the Jimmy Fallon show. NBC 3 Steve Irwin died in 2006, his son Robert was just two at the time 
The teenager, who looks just like his dad, expertly showed off a host of exotic animals to Jimmy and certainly seemed to know his stuff. 
Visiting LA to promote a charity dinner in honour of his father, Robert Irwin explained that he was happy to be following in his dad’s footsteps by appearing on the show, as his father had years before. 
Professing his love for animals, Robert said that dealing with animals is “in his blood.” 
He explained: “I actually grew up at Australia Zoo. I think I’m the luckiest kid in the world.” Steve Irwin's son Robert follows his Dad's footsteps on the tonight show with Jimmy Fallon 
Robert, who works with his mother Terri and big sister Bindi at the family's 100-acre zoo, went on to show the TV presenter a crocodile, a screaming armadillo, a snake and a sloth. 
Jimmy Fallon also noticed the similarities between the teen and his dad, and stated: "It's so cool to see you like this, you're actually your dad." NBC Thirteen-year-old Robert Irwin appeared on US talk show Tonight With Jimmy Fallon to talk about animals, just like his famous dad MEGA 3 Robert Irwin, along with his mother Terri and sister Bindi, works at a 100-acre zoo in Australia 
Roberts older sister Bindi, 18, also took to social media to make the comparison, tweeting her pride with a message to her brother: "Tears in my eyes. So proud of Robert tonight. Robert, you are more and more like Dad every day. I'm forever thankful to be your sister." Tears in my eyes.So proud of Robert tonight ❤️Robert, you are more and more like Dad every day.I'm forever thankful to be your sister. pic.twitter.com/XE0qcbcAIY 
Recently, Bindi herself showed off her skills with animals when she was filmed wrestling a 15ft crocodile , while her boyfriend Chandler Powell tried his hand at taming a croc too .
